caption.p: M. pneumoniae IgG and IgM antibody test results in relation to onset of illness among the cases (63 cases, 95 specimens) who had laboratory evidence of acute or recent M. pneumoniae infection (a PCR positive test result in the respiratory specimen, or a seroconversion or more than a twofold rise in IgG EIU between paired serum samples, or a serology with IgM > 3.0 S/CO and IgG > 45 EIU)
